page.title: 16SURVEY ON TRANSPORT,CHEADLE.
page.content: WE CARRIED OUT A SURVEY AMONGST THE CHILDREN IN OUR CLASS CONCERNING TRANSPORT. ALTHOUGH THERE ARE FREQUENT BUS SERVICES ALONG ALL THE MAJOR ROADS WITH SHORT DISTANCES BETWEEN STOPS, NOT ONE OF THE SERVICES TRAVELS INTO THE HOUSING AREAS. MOST OF THE FAMILIES HAVE AT LEAST ONE CAR, BUT FOR THOSE WITHOUT THEIR OWN VEHICLES THE LACK OF PUBLIC TRANSPORT CAN CAUSE HARDSHIP. THIS IS PARTICULALY SO FOR THE HANDICAPPED AND THE OLDER RESIDENTS WHO ARE RELIANT UPON THE GOOD WILL OF OTHERS. THE FEELING OF ISOLATION WHICH SOME PEOPLE SEEM TO FEEL IS AGGRAVATED BY THE LACK OF REASONABLY PRICED TAXIES IN THE DISTRICT.
